item.title: Poor and inadequate repairs, 28th April
item.description:
I have previously reported the poor condition of the road surface on this roundabout. Last night there was 3 or 4 vehicles plus 6+ men on site making repairs. Very disappointed that they have not completed the job - there are still substantial pot holes and the surface is still unsafe for cyclists. It is very frustrating as a cyclist, tax and rate payer to see that the Council is wasting resources by not completing repairs correctly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 93 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disintegrating road surface, 28th April
item.description:
Several smaller holes beginning to coalesce into one very large hole. Needs urgent repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Greenway Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long stretch of potholes, 27th April
item.description:
There is a long stretch of potholes and poor road service next to all the smooth and widened pavements. Current road closures are forcing more cars on this route
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Leckhampton Lodge Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole damaged my car, 27th April
item.description:
Harp Hill pothole between Oakley Road and school, I can see other reports, no action to be fixed. It's right next to my house, I have damaged my wheels when trying to park on my driveway. It's a lease car, to be returned at the end of May. I'm going to submit a claim once I get the invoice and direct to you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Hillview Villas Harp Hill, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hole in road, 27th April
item.description:
Pot hole has been here for weeks and is now growing by the day. Quite deep and ragged.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Birdlip

item.title: Stone chippings covering pavement, 27th April
item.description:
Stone chippings have been flung up from the road surface after resurfacing and potholes forming. These are covering the pavement surface on the south side of the A40. This makes it hard to walk along and potentially dangerous for wheeled transport such as scooters, bikes and will be bad for pushchairs, wheelchairs etc as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 382 Gloucester Road, Saint Marks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely deep and damaging series of potholes, 26th April
item.description:
Potholes over 10cm deep, in a series of other smaller, but still damaging potholes. Urgent repair needed. Damaging to vehicles, possibly fatal to motorcyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of potholes together, 26th April
item.description:
Making one large pothole that everyone avoids. Cyclist find this impossible to cycle on. Very dangerous. What are you thinking leaving this like this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 85 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed Manhole Cover, 26th April
item.description:
There has been a hole in the pavement in Pittville Street for many weeks and there was a barrier around it but Cheltenham BID Ambassadors are continually picking them up, putting them back whilst there is no sign of the problem being rectified. But it now appears that a local business has acquired one of the barriers to help them reserve a parking spot. Please help!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Winchcombe Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very noisy manhole cover/pothole, 26th April
item.description:
This manhole cover on London Road has been replaced every year /18 months- never properly. It is really loud as cars drive over it. At night time I have to keep my windows shut as it keeps me awake

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 294 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
